conclusion: Determine which container the liquid will flow into from points A, B, and C by tracing the path of the liquid as it interacts with the baffles.
Liquid from A starts at point A and flows downward.
The first baffle liquid from A encounters is the cyan baffle, angled to direct the liquid towards the right.
Liquid from A hits the red baffle, angled to direct the liquid towards the left.
Liquid from A encounters the green baffle, directing it further to the left.
Liquid from A reaches the bottom and flows into container D.
Liquid from B starts at point B and flows downward.
The first baffle liquid from B encounters is the yellow baffle, angled to direct the liquid towards the left.
Liquid from B hits the red baffle, angled to direct the liquid towards the right.
Liquid from B encounters the white baffle, directing it further to the right.
Liquid from B reaches the bottom and flows into container F.
Liquid from C starts at point C and flows downward.
The first baffle liquid from C encounters is the pink baffle, angled to direct the liquid towards the left.
Liquid from C hits the red baffle, angled to direct the liquid towards the right.
Liquid from C encounters the white baffle, directing it further to the right.
Liquid from C reaches the bottom and flows into container G.
Final answer: Liquid from A flows into container D, liquid from B flows into container F, and liquid from C flows into container G.
